sentence.content: The Office of Fair Trading said Tuesday it was investigating a complaint alleging anti-competitive practices by a London-based diamond cartel controlled by South Africa&apost;s giant De Beers diamond organization.

sentence.content: The watchdog body said De Beers ``appeared to have&apost;&apost; a monopoly on diamond trading in London and it was interested in establishing whether there had been an abuse of the monopoly.

sentence.content: Consolidated Gold Fields PLC, a British mining concern with no diamond interests, acknowledged that it filed the complaint as a defensive move against a stalled takeover bid by Luxembourg-based Minorco SA.

sentence.content: The British government is expected to rule in the next few weeks whether to allow Minorco to proceed with its 2.9 billion-pound (about $5.1 billion) bid for Consolidated Gold following an investigation by the Monopolies and Mergers Commission.
